comment.author: 46033226@N00
comment._content: the course of Truelove never did run smooth...

comment.author: 11334970@N05
comment._content:
Through the research of a curator we can now update the information about this image. It is now known that this is Donald Manson, Ice Master of 'Phoenix' (1832) and not Captain Parker of the Hull whaler 'Truelove'.

Lucinda

comment.author: 66822923@N02
comment._content:
Lucinda,

Please can you confirm that this is correct and who the curator is who researched this photo?

Captain John Parker of the 'Truelove' was my grandmother's grandfather - my g-g-grandfather.

Thank you,

Andrew Morrison

comment.author: 11334970@N05
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/66822923@N02] 
Hi Aindreas1

While viewing the Inglefield Album, at the Royal Archives, Windsor Castle our curator noticed that this person was identified as Mason. The album was annotated by Inglefield himself. Other evidence has also corroborated this.

Lucinda

comment.author: 66822923@N02
comment._content:
Lucinda,

Sorry for the delay in replying but thank you very much for this information.

I have tried, unsuccessfully, to attach a picture of what Capt. John Parker, whale master, actually looked like and I have this photo in my possession.Without his beard  he might look quite like Donald Manson.

Is there any way I can send the photo to you?

Regards,

Andrew Morrison
